newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Threatened Belgian steelworkers urge mass protest.
newsitem.headline: Threatened Belgian steelworkers urge mass protest.

text.p: Hundreds of workers facing redundancy at bankrupt Belgian steelmaker Forges De Clabecq fanned out across the country on Saturday calling for mass support at a demonstration next month against sackings.

Belga news agency said 10 coaches were carrying the workers from a meeting at the steelworks in Tubize, south of Brussels, to cities all over Belgium where they will distribute leaflets urging participation in a march for work planned for February 2.
The coaches were heading for Brussels, Antwerp, Ghent, Bruges, Charleroi, Mons, Liege, Ath and Namur, Belga said.

Liquidators have been trying to salvage the firm since January 3 when the Belgian Commercial Court ruled Clabecq bankrupt after the government of Belgium's Francophone Walloon region -- the company's biggest shareholder -- refused to put up On Thursday the Walloon government turned down a request by the liquidators to come up with 800 million francs ($24 million) that would allow most of the 1,800 workers to be kept on for a further three months while back orders were filled.
The liquidators argue that filling the orders would generate goodwill for the firm and give them breathing space to find a buyer.
However, the unions have also rejected the plan and called on the court to reverse its January 3 ruling. The court is due to decide on Tuesday or Wednesday next week.
